rComments: Hard Grader

Very passionate about what he teaches. Lectures are long, but interesting and funny. He seems to know that HAVC 30 is a GE and therefore teaches appropriately. Midterm and final are super easy as long as you do the study guide. Essays are a bit harder, but with a solid amount of effort and research you can easily get an A.

The mid term and final were pretty clear cut as long as you went to lecture and did the study guide(which basically was the test). The papers are harder though, the instructions weren't super clear and when I went for help he didn't really clarify anything or help me.

Langdale was awesome! He keeps the lectures interesting and cracks a few jokes here and there. He is always open to student input. You can definitely get an A if you go to lecture and take really good notes, it'll help for the exams. One writing assignment (easy), one midterm, a final, and a final paper (start early). Couple of required readings.

Langdale is really cool. He made the class really interesting. There is a lot of memorizing and a few online readings for this class but not very hard. Had to write two papers throughout the quarter, + take a midterm and Final. Overall it's an easy class if you go to lecture and study hard for the exams you'll be good.

My bf and I took this class, and we enjoyed it. Lectures were interesting and although there was a lot of information, we were never bored. BUThis final exam was tough and required you to describe various different pieces of artarchitecture and answer questions about them. I ended up with almost 200 flashcards. Good class but not an easy GE.

Do not take this class if you're looking for an easy GE! It's an upper div, and the exams are difficult, tons of memorization, with no study guides or reviews. I was struggling and Langdale was really unhelpful, so I dropped the class. Some interesting material but overall I wouldn't recommend the course.
Chill class, Good professor. Hard Earned A

So this was a last minute class for me, I didn't realize it was upper-div (I'm a freshman). The class was interesting enough, however it's a LOT of work. If the final wasn't curved I would not have passed. I also feel my lack of Biblical knowledge hindered me in this class. He's a passionate dude, it was just a harder class than I expected.

Not a easy GE. That aside, Allan is a great lecturer and very interested in the material. Grades consist of: a short paper, a midterm, a research paper (6 page) and a final. All tests are based solely on inclass slides. While recommended, reading rarely appears on test nor will you need your textbook. Take good notes and start you paper early.

Allan is a fantastic professor. Took Italian Ren. with him and it was great. His TA's are pretty tough graders but they give great feedback, and his midterm was mostly slide recognition. Very enthusiastic about his subject, funny, and brought great balance to a HAVC class. He also never shoves his opinions down your throat which was refreshing!

took his renaissance art history course. very entertaining and informative. class seemed kinda hard, so i put a lot of effort into it. it payed off with an A and more importantly a new appreciation for Renaissance art

Presentations are clear..includes discussion. He is very funny and helpful. I didn't know much about the topic but learned plenty. Overall, really enjoyed it but the TA's were a little demanding. No textbook needed, readings online, not that many, they're easy to keep up with. Make sure you really know the art & architectures for tests.

Allan is a really good professor, and this class was great. His TA's grade really hard, since there was no section lecture was mandatory or you would basically fail the class. The midterm and final are impossible if you don't study and take good notes. This class is not for people who are looking for easy GE credit.

Great class, he's really smart and has the cutest stories. You can tell that he's really passionate about renaissance art. His tests are usually just slide ids and an essay at the end. Make sure to do the readings for discussion days!

A very articulate and eloquent professor. He's great at leading in class discussion. His ta cher was a tough grader but extremely helpful with the feedback she offers. Highly recommend taking a class with this prof.

Has a strong mind and opinion. However, not too into the students' opinions so it seems. I took this pass/no pass so I had a leisurely class time. If I did not then I'd totally have not enjoyed his class. Tests were not too structured, but still fair. Study the study guides, if he gives you any.

I have had Allan for 5 HAVC classes. At first I didn't like him but if you talk in class and email him questions you have he is very helpful and it gets you on his good side. Lectures are interesting and he is very knowledgeable about the subjects. Attendance is mandatory but its mostly important to show interest in the class.

Seriously, if you want take take a Havc class get him as your teacher. Anyone who thinks its ok to skip classes for no reason and doesn't pay attention in lecture gets what they deserve from him and thoose who actually want to take the class are in for a treat.

Allan Langdale has the magical ability to make anything he talks about unbearably boring.  He made attendance mandatory because no one was coming, but if you can get a friend to sign you in, you should.  Lecture material was completely irrelevant to the essays. No tests, but everything I learned from that class was from the final research paper.

Very boring. All lectures were just descriptions of different churches in Europe. Nobody was going to lectures so he made them mandatory and passed around a signup sheet. The essays were on completely different subjects than the lectures. Easy class, but in my opinion not worth it.

A great teacher with sincere interest in his students as well as material. Leaves many assignments open ended to allow for creativity and exploration of subjects and expects students to have some self-motivation. I really enjoyed his course and he is always approachable and responsive to concerns and questions.
Bad at letting you know when assignments are due and how to do them.
He was a great teacher and really understanding! This is a good teacher to have if you want to take a HAVC class.

Alla was an awesome professor with a sense of humor. He is open to questions and straight forward in his lecturs. Be sure to take notes because it's mainly where the test questions derive from, which aren't that bad.
